items.title: St. Dominic Savio
items.summary: The student of St. John Bosco who chose 'Death rather than sin.'

items.title: St. Tarcisius
items.summary: The young martyr of the Eucharist who died protecting the Blessed Sacrament.

items.title: St. Maria Goretti
items.summary: A model of purity and forgiveness who pardoned her attacker before her death.

items.title: St. Philomena
items.summary: A powerful young thaumaturge and virgin martyr of the early Church.

items.title: St. Agnes of Rome
items.summary: The young girl who refused to marry, declaring herself a bride of Christ.

items.title: St. Rose of Viterbo
items.summary: A young preacher and visionary who defended the Church in 13th-century Italy.

items.title: St. Imelda Lambertini
items.summary: Patroness of First Communicants, who died in an ecstasy of love for the Eucharist.

items.title: St. Vitus
items.summary: One of the Fourteen Holy Helpers, known for his miraculous courage as a boy.

items.title: St. Jose Sanchez Del Rio
items.summary: The 14-year-old Cristero martyr who died shouting 'Viva Cristo Rey!'

items.title: St. Crescentius of Rome
items.summary: An 11-year-old child who bore witness to Christ during the Diocletian persecutions.

items.title: St. Carlo Acutis
items.summary: The millennial 'Cyber-Apostle of the Eucharist' who used the web for the Gospel.
